content: i have used three colour pallets for this blanket to get the contrast of the swirls melbourne australia 8 bold colours for the highs - ranging from 8 to 40+ deg c 8 pastel colours for the lows - ranging from -1 to 20 deg c white 3 shades of grey and black for rainfall - no rain 1-7mm 8-14mm 15-21mm 22+ i used 5ply cotton and a 3 5mm hook each motif measures approximately 3 5 inch 9cm amount of yarn required will vary for different regions you will need more for middle of the range temperatures and less for extreme temperatures instructions for borders or fillers are not included ©kaye adolphson 2022 slip_stitch slip_stitch chain chain 0 double_crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet half treble treble_crochet treble colour a = low temp colour b = high temp colour c = rainfall start with colour c if you don t want rainfall start with colour a 5ch join with slip_stitch to 1st chain to form a ring place on a stitch holder take care to keep loop at the front of work and working tail at the back join colour a to ring work 2dc 2htr & 3tr into ring do not fasten_off remove hook and leave a large loop for later or place on a stitch holder work over ends of colour a & c as you go squash stitches up so that they take up half the space ©kaye adolphson 2022 join colour b to ring next to last treble_crochet work 2dc 2htr & 3tr into ring continue to work over ends of colour a & c keep colour c loop at the front take care not to catch the working tail you should be able to adjust this loop from now on work into stitches of adjoining yarn you will need to drop one yarn and pick up the yarn to your left as you go work a on top of b and b on top of a in an anticlockwise direction continue with colour b pink row 1 b 3tr into next stitch 1tr in next stitch twice 3tr in next stitch you should end up two stitches from the end of colour a blue if you slip your ring finger in the loop of colour a it makes it easier to work in those last stitches change to colour a blue 3tr into next stitch 1tr in next stitch twice 3tr in next stitch work over tail of colour b as you work stitches you can snip off tails when you think they are secure enough you should end up at opposite ends of spiral ©kaye adolphson 2022 row 2 a 1tr in each of the next 3tr 3tr in next treble_crochet 3 times loop colour b in ring finger 3tr clusters should be in the middle stitch of previous cluster you should end up with one stitch left repeat for colour b you should end up at opposite ends of spiral row 3 b 1tr in
